channel.title: Black h'ween messed up
channel.description: my black hween is in the wrong spot it's in the weapon slot and it barely shows when worn any help? click to pic to see

item.title: Black h'ween messed up
item.dc:creator: @owwch_u_died owwch u died
item.description:
@owwch_u_died wrote:

If its 317 and a deltascape source, go under item.java in your main files.

Youll see Amulet int, helm int etc, add your black h’ween code under the helmet category.

If its not delta based im not too sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Black h'ween messed up
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Your itemDef has nothing to do with it. Wherever items are handled within the source, this isn’t a client sided error.

Read full topic

item.title: Black h'ween messed up
item.dc:creator: @austinx austinx
item.description:
@austinx wrote:

case 15282:
itemDef.name = “@bla@Black h’ween Mask”;
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[1] = “Wear”;
itemDef.originalModelColors = new int[1];
itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[1];
itemDef.originalModelColors[0] = 926; //original color
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[0] = 0; //changed color
itemDef.modelID = 2438;
itemDef.modelZoom = 730;
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 516;
itemDef.modelRotation2 = 0;
itemDef.maleEquip1 = 3188;
itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 3192;
itemDef.description = “Aaaarrrghhh… I’m a monster.”.getBytes();
break;

thats what my ints are sorry i didnt know what u ment ^^^ thanks for helping a bit though ;p ill look around for what u said

Read full topic

item.title: Black h'ween messed up
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

You never defined it to be a hat. Search around for something like one of the following in wherever items are handled.
public static int hat[] =
public static int helm[] =
public static int fullHelm[] =
public static int helmet[] =

I don’t use Project Insanity so I wouldn’t know what the int is named.
